p: Birds in fresh or salt water environments are the primary reservoirs of IAVs where infections are largely non-pathogenic, replicating in the gastrointestinal tract, and the viruses are shed into the water where they are taken up, likely by oral and respiratory routes, to infect other individuals [ 11, 21]. Apart from the bat viruses, all IAVs in mammalian species, including humans, ultimately originate from viruses in wild birds, either directly or via intermediate hosts.
